bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, August 25, 1922

div1.p: Russell reports that White discovered a case of yellow fever in Tampico. He believes that this indicates a continued presence of the disease in that region.

August 25, 1922
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
Your letter of August 17 and enclosure ar-
rived promptly. I have returned to Doctor White his paper
on the Epidemiology and Prophylaxis of Yellow Fever, and a
copy of your letter of criticism, as Doctor White requested.

I was very glad to be able to read both; yellow
fever has always been an interesting disease, and its im-
portance to me is of course greatly increased since I
joined this board.

We received a wire Tuesday from Doctor White,
informing us that Connor had reported a positive case in
Panuco, inland from Tampico. This positive case was pre-
ceded by two suspicious deaths. It seems probable now,
therefore, that there is still a focus in Panuco, and that
work will have to be continued there for a considerable
time.
I trust you are having a good vacation.
div1.closer:
Yours very sincerely, F F Russell Dr. H. R. Carter
New Glasgow P.O.
Annert County, Va.
“Geddes”. FFR:EP
